column4: hey, I'm having an issue with getting the nvidia driver to work -- my X got reconfigured. Last time I had this problem ubuntu was using the driver from an earlier kernel. nvidia-xconfig does not work nor does nvidia-settings. how do I make sure my computer is loading the right nvidia driver?
open hardware drivers tool and see if the nvidia driver is enabled there
it says "a different version" of the 185 driver is in use. I've tried installing it before but it goes back to saying this
how did you install the nvidia drivers in the earlier ubuntu release ?
I'm not sure. It's possible that I compiled it
that's probably the reason then as it's an unsupported confiugration
the upgrade won't have known about it as it was outside the package manager
so what should I do? compile again?
certainly not, that will just make it less supportible
what should I do? should I try a different version?
no, as the modules you installed will still be in use
